clues.text: This movie "Daredevil" is lucky at cards: he won the 2004 California State Poker Championship

Huzzah!  The Old Globe Theatre in this city's Balboa Park is celebrating its 70th anniversary in 2005
At L.A.'s George C. Page Museum, watch scientists clean & identify specimens plucked from this primeval pool next door
This town in the Santa Ynez valley is "The Danish capital of America", so, yes, you'll find lots of pastry there
The power went out on this Houston company when it declared bankruptcy in December 2001
This airline's "Friendly Skies" were darkened by its Dec. 2002 bankruptcy
In Jan. 2002 this undersea fiber optic telecom co. founded by Gary Winnick sank beneath the bankruptcy waves
$11 billion in alleged fraud might've played a tiny part in this long-distance co.'s July 2002 bankruptcy
Conspiracy & fraud led to a June 2002 "reorganization" of this cable co. led by the Rigas family
In the '70s Jon Landau wrote he saw rock & roll's future & its name was this Jersey guy; guess he was right
1930's "Anna Christie" was advertised with the line "Garbo" does this
Opening at No. 1 at the box office in 2004, a prequel to this 1973 horror flick really "turned some heads"
Imitation gruel & "Non-Toxic Kologne" are endorsed by this "Simpsons" "k"lown

Born in 1906, Samuel Beckett attended Trinity College in this city
Beckett won this big prize in 1969, but declined the trip to Sweden to avoid the public speeches at the ceremony
It's the English title of the play Beckett originally worte in French as "Fin de partie"
Beckett is a major dramatist of the "Theater of" this, which portrays a bewildered & anxious humanity
It's subtitled "A Tragicomedy in Two Acts"
Not surprisingly, in Korean this city's name means "capital city"
In 1831 the city of Thang Long changed its name to this, a capital idea by the Vietnamese
In exile, Lenin ran a training school for Russian revolutionists at Longjumeau, a suburb of this capital city
Razed in the 16th century, the reconstructed ruins of Templo Mayor are found in this capital's Zocalo
Honoring one of the country's famous sons, the Universidad de Belgrano is found in this South American capital
Your body's metabolism is regulated by hormones from this gland
After meeting the basic requirements for scout, a Boy Scout achieves this rank
This word for a device popularized in the 1800s can mean to signal your plans unintentionally
This lover of Cressida was killed by Achilles
It's the "bewitching" first name of Stephen King's wife; she's an author, too
This 4-word phrase precedes "He will come" in the film "Field of Dreams"
After eating quince "with a runcible spoon", the Owl & the Pussycat "danced by" this
This advice by General Nathan Bedford Forrest is often misquoted, using "fustest" & "mostest"
In the Who song "My Generation", this line follows & rhymes with "Things they do look awful cold"
clues.response: "Hope I die before I get old"

clues.text: Nelson Algren advised, "Never play cards with a man called Doc.  Never eat at a place called" this
The term "campus" began at Princeton to distinguish its grounds from this school's "yard"
The colors of Notre Dame's athletic teams are blue & this
Sports teams from Grambling, Clemson & Auburn share this nickname
Following the Civil War, the University of Florida moved from Ocala to this city
College Station, home to this Texas school, got its name from the railroad station built to serve the college
After an 1891 roulette run, Charles Wells was known as "The man who broke the bank at" this place
Ethnicity of noted gambling figures Nick Dandolos & Jimmy Snyder, nee Synodinos
"Canada Bill" Jones was a 3-card monte wizard on these transports, where Iowans can now legally bet
This self-help group's first meeting was held in L.A. on Sept. 13, 1957, but we can't tell you who was there
In "A Day At the Races" he gives Groucho a tip on a horse; in real life he always had a bet down
Before serving in the Gulf, he led the U.S. ground force that invaded Grenada
Long before this "old soldier" faded away, he was an aide to President Theodore Roosevelt
He commanded members of 3 state militias & some pirates to victory at the Battle of New Orleans
During WWII, this tank commander led the 7th Army's assault on Sicily
In 1917 this general was selected to organize & lead WWI's American Expeditionary Force
The 48-story pyramid-shaped Transamerica Building dominates this city's skyline
A jacket with a pyramid on the back causes confusion for Madonna & Rosanna Arquette in this movie
The temple of Kukulcan sits atop a pyramid called El Castillo in this ruined Mayan city
From the Assyrian for "summit", it's a terraced pyramid of the ancient Babylonians
A type of pyramid scheme is named for this swindler who pulled it in the 1920s

rounds.text: In 1798 George wrote to John Greenwood, a man in this profession, "I am...ready to pay what ever you may charge me"
